intro: Dipteracanthus lanceolatus, commonly known as the lanceleaf dipteracanthus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with similar morphological traits. Its botanical features make it a notable species in tropical horticulture and ecological studies.
